Tucson growls in pain and bravely tries to endure the pain of the penetrati=
on into his shoulder.  Not even agony would keep him from doing what he so =
passionately set out to do.  He concentrates on the figure on the bed, and =
bravely endures the burning sting of the attack, not giving into it's venom=
us scourge on his system.

" I'm here, don't worry, a bee sting isn't going=
 to stop me from doing what I came here to do, trust me.  You'll be all rig=
ht, I promise."



He keeps his hand on the figure's chest, as he now looks=
 at the insect who impailed him. His stare is cold and adament, an expressi=
on commonly used by Optimus Prime who had many legendary battles against Me=
gatron back in the day.

"If you're looking to drain my power, you're defin=
itely going about it the wrong way.  You won't find it there, or anywhere y=
ou think is accessable."

His compassion to successfully bring Rodimus back=
, fuels his determination, and stamina.  He remains strong, although in som=
e considerable pain, he shows no sign of weakening.  The power that was dri=
ving him was the power of the most simplest of creatures.  A power he suspe=
cted was not at all exhibited by his insectile enemy.  He gives Vestige a n=
odd, letting him know that he was all right, and then turns to the insect o=
nce more.

" You have no sense of compassion therefore you can not fight a =
power that is not familliar to you.  I knew that, I knew that from the firs=
t time I encountered you.  So why do you keep on trying to defeat me, when =
you have no inclination of what power I'm using to defend my comrades and m=
yself?  Think about it, if you keep fighting it will only weaken you. If yo=
u do not, and surrender, you may spare yourself a lot of grief and hardship=
.  I know you can colonize, and a colony should be able to find alternate s=
ources of food and fuel.  You may not have compassion but you have intellig=
ence.  If I were you I'd start using it before something adverse happens to=
 you."

He narrows his optics at the insectoid. 
--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.=
com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson =
grits his teeth and bares the pain inflicted on him. He was not about to gi=
ve up now, not when Rodimus really needed him. He remembered how Vestige ha=
d been invigorated by his transfer of power from his chest core, where a be=
ating heart still pulsates. It would prove useful again, and this time, he =
needed a way to channel that power into the figure lying on the bed. He use=
s his arm to shield away the insects who were stinging him. With the other =
arm, he reaches out to the figure's chest, and puts his hand on him gently.=
 He concentrates deeply and tries to channel his own spirituality into the =
figure lying on the bed. His very soul now acting upon his heart out of the=
 one power that no force could fight. The power of compassion, of love, and=
 of loyalty.
> >
> > " Rodimus, I'm here now, and there is nothing that wil=
l stop me from bringing you back. My hand is here for you now. And this tim=
e, I will never let go."
> 
> <NEW>
>

e them, thier movements relentless and even some how

y knew that somethng was about to go dreadfully

 Tuscon!

y

bed shuddered once more as bright optics lit up and

ever at the same time Tuscon could feel the
